alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 15 at 7:19AM AKDT until October 15 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of up to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Northeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could reduce visibility. Travel could be hazardous. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow early this morning is expected to transition to a wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain by mid to late morning before transitioning to all rain around noon. The wintry mix of precipitation may persist into the afternoon through Thompson Pass. Higher winds are expected through Thompson Pass this morning, leading to the potential for some blowing snow and reduced visibilities.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
